Judul: On The Formation Of Limit Cycle Of The Friction-Induced Stick-Slip Vibration In Oilwell Drillstring
Abstrak:
In this paper, the stick-slip vibration in oilwell drillstring is studied. The drilling system is modelled
as a lumped-parameter torsional pendulum and the interaction between the drill bit and the rock is
treated as Coulomb friction. Equation of motion of the drill bit is established and the dynamic
responses of the drill bit are obtained. A drilling system with the drillstring length 3000 m is
analysed, in which the system parameters are selected by reference to the actual drilling situation.
After the slip vibrations in the initial stage, final state of the drill bit is a stable stick-slip vibration of
which the limit cycle is a closed loop. In order to find the stability of the limit cycle corresponds to
the periodically stick-slip vibration, different initial conditions for the drill bit are studied. Results
show that the drill bit will lead to a periodic motion and the phase trajectories ultimately converge
to the same limit cycle corresponds to stable stick-slip vibration
Kata Kunci: Stick-slip vibration, Friction, Drillstring, Drill bit, Limit cycle
